prompt:
Design a small electronics enclosure as a parametric part: outer box 120 mm x 80 mm x 35 mm with 3 mm wall thickness and an open top. Use a construction that works with the available tools:

1) Create the outer block: sketch rectangle on Top plane with corners (-60 mm,-40 mm) to (60 mm,40 mm), then extrude 35 mm (NEW).
2) Hollow it to a tube: sketch inner rectangle on Top plane with corners (-57 mm,-37 mm) to (57 mm,37 mm) and REMOVE THROUGH_ALL to create walls.
3) Add the bottom/floor: sketch the original outer rectangle again on Top plane and extrude 3 mm with operation ADD (this forms the floor while keeping the top open).
4) Add 4 internal mounting bosses: cylinders radius 4 mm, height 12 mm at (x=±47 mm, y=±27 mm) (10 mm from each inside corner). Use operation ADD so they merge.
5) Drill boss holes: diameter 3 mm at the same boss centers, REMOVE THROUGH_ALL.

Use explicit mm units and validate with onshape_snapshot_partstudio.
